oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The washing day: a proper new ballad for wet weather
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheet music covers; Fictitious characters; Laundry; Weather; Clotheslines
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Drawing of an angry-looking man in dressing gown and cap, with glasses perched on his forehead. He appears in the clouds above a clothesline holding laundry. On the ground are baskets, pails, an iron, and scrubbing brushes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clay, Edward Williams, 1799-1857
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Kenneth D. Rose Sheet Music Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Song lyrics lament the writer's wife's poor temperament on washing days. A good example of the genre of comic songs popular in the late nineteenth century. Author anonymous; song lyrics thought to have been written between 1817 and 1819.
